title: Pedagogical Preparation for Teaching Vocational Subjects
banerDescription: Gain pedagogical qualifications and prepare for a career as a teacher.
description:
• Individuals who want to obtain pedagogical qualifications
  • Professionals aiming to work as teachers
  • People interested in gaining knowledge in pedagogy, psychology, and didactics
description2: The goal of postgraduate studies is to provide preparation in psychology, pedagogy, and detailed didactics, ensuring the acquisition of knowledge and practical skills necessary for the teaching profession in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 20, 2018, Law on Higher Education and Science (Journal of Laws 2018 item 1668 as amended) and the Regulation of the Minister of Science and Higher Education of July 25, 2019, on the standards of education preparing for the teaching profession (Journal of Laws item 1450 of August 2, 2019).
description3: The studies prepare individuals to work as teachers, vocational educators, trainers, lecturers, tutors, pedagogues, school psychologists, after-school care educators, dormitory/internship supervisors, instructors, and librarians.

topics.title: Legal and Organizational Foundations of School/Facility Functioning
Core Curriculum of Preschool and General Education
Diagnosis, Monitoring, and Assessment of Educational Outcomes
Personal and Professional Development of a Teacher
Workplace Safety and Hygiene in Educational Institutions
Didactics of Teaching Theoretical Vocational Subjects
Information Technology and Media in the Teaching Process

faculty: Classes are conducted by experienced practitioners in pedagogy, psychology, and didactics, with many years of experience in educational work.
practices:
• The professional internship includes 150 hours and provides hands-on teaching experience.
  • Internships can be completed at educational institutions at various levels.
evaluation: Assessment of learning outcomes is based on class participation, completion of module tasks, internship performance, and preparation of a final project.
jobOpportunities:
Graduates of the program will be prepared to work as:

  • Teachers in schools and educational institutions
  • Vocational educators, trainers, lecturers, tutors
  • Pedagogues, school psychologists
  • After-school care educators, dormitory/internship supervisors
  • Instructors, librarians
invite: Gain pedagogical preparation and start your career in education.
